intro: Sinapis sinensis, commonly known as Chinese mustard, is an annual herbaceous plant native to China. It belongs to the Brassicaceae family, which includes other well-known plants like cabbage and broccoli. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–100 cm and has pinnately lobed leaves. Its flowers are small, yellow, and arranged in racemes, while the fruits are pods containing several seeds. Sinapis sinensis is valued for its edible leaves and seeds, which are used in traditional Chinese cuisine and herbal medicine.
